items.title: UK researchers develop AI to monitor animal emotions
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Scientists are using AI to enhance animal welfare by detecting facial expressions that indicate stress, pain, or discomfort.
- The notable system, Intellipig, was developed by researchers from the University of the West of England Bristol (UWE) and Scotland‚Äôs Rural College (SRUC).
- Intellipig uses cameras to analyze pigs‚Äô facial features as they enter feeding stalls, alerting farmers to signs of distress.
- AI applications in animal welfare extend to various species, including horses, cats, and sheep.
- Researchers have developed algorithms that detect pain or stress by identifying facial points such as the edges of the eyes and nostrils.
- These systems can perform tasks more quickly and accurately than humans, detecting subtle facial movements that might go unnoticed.
- Experts emphasize the need for oversight and continued refinement to capture more complex aspects of animal emotions.

items.title: South Korea suspends access to DeepSeek
items.summary:
- South Korea suspended the domestic operations of the Chinese AI app DeepSeek on Feb. 15, 2025.
- The decision was announced by the country‚Äôs data protection authority on Feb. 17, 2025.
- Suspension will remain until DeepSeek complies with South Korea‚Äôs privacy regulations.

items.title: Spotify plans $6 Music Pro service with AI, ticket perks
items.summary:
- Spotify is developing a new premium service called Music Pro costing an additional US$5.99 per month.
- Expected launch is in late 2025, with regional pricing variations.
- Music Pro will feature AI-powered tools like song mixing and benefits for live events, including presale access and better seating.
- Spotify is negotiating with music promoters and ticket sellers, though details are not finalized.
- This move comes as Spotify faces slow growth in North America and Europe, competing with services like Apple Music and Amazon Music Unlimited.
- Spotify currently has 675 million users globally.

items.title: OpenAI updates ChatGPT policy for neutrality, diversity
items.summary:
- OpenAI announced a policy update to enhance intellectual freedom and neutrality in AI training.
- ChatGPT will now address a wider range of questions while providing multiple perspectives on contentious topics.
- The update emphasizes truth-seeking and discourages editorial stances, allowing for representation of diverse viewpoints on sensitive issues.
- Refer to OpenAI's revised [Model Specification document](https://www.techinasia.com/news/openai-updates-chatgpt-policy-neutrality-diversity) for detailed changes.

items.title: Meta may engage Trump over EU regulations
items.summary:
- Meta's head of global policy, Joel Kaplan, suggested potential engagement with the Trump administration if EU regulations are seen as unfairly targeting Meta.
- Kaplan emphasized that any discriminatory treatment should be reported to the US government.
- Meta faces over ‚Ç¨2 billion in EU fines for various violations and is under investigation for potential breaches of the Digital Services Act.
- Kaplan criticized EU regulations, claiming they damage Europe's economic competitiveness and should not be assessed solely based on fines.
- The comments reflect ongoing tensions between Washington and Brussels regarding digital policies, with Trump previously labeling EU fines as a form of taxation.

items.title: DeepSeek boosts Chinese smart EVs with AI features
items.summary:
- Chinese EV manufacturers are adopting AI technology from DeepSeek amid increasing competition.
- Major automakers like BYD and Leapmotor are integrating DeepSeek‚Äôs AI features into their vehicles to enhance safety through advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS).
- The technology also aims to improve infotainment and overall driving experience.

items.title: Broadcom, TSMC reportedly exploring deals to split Intel
items.summary:
- Broadcom and TSMC are reportedly looking into potential deals involving Intel.  
- Discussions are at preliminary stages and may involve dividing Intel into segments.  
- Broadcom is interested in Intel's chip design and marketing, while TSMC may invest in Intel's manufacturing operations.  
- Broadcom is seeking partners to assist with managing Intel's manufacturing division before proceeding.  
- No comments have been made by Intel, TSMC, Broadcom, or the White House regarding these discussions.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia introduces Glasswall to help startup founders choose the right investors.
- Glasswall allows founders to anonymously share reviews about venture capitalists (VCs).
- The initiative aims to provide candid feedback for VCs and support more informed decisions for entrepreneurs.
- Founders are encouraged to leave reviews, which are crucial for Glasswall's success, especially regarding active investors in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Temu, Shein face uncertainty after Trump‚Äôs tariff change
items.summary:
- Chinese cross-border merchants and logistics providers are facing challenges due to tariff changes announced by President Trump.
- Trump announced a 10% increase in tariffs on Chinese goods and removed a duty exemption for lower-value packages but postponed these changes on Feb. 7.
- E-commerce platforms such as Temu and Shein have not yet provided updates regarding these tariff changes.
- Despite the uncertainty, logistics operations and costs have remained stable.
- Recent developments include Temu's shift to a 'half-custody' supply model and plans for market entry into South Korea.

items.title: Musk‚Äôs xAI to unveil Grok 3 AI chatbot
items.summary:
- Elon Musk announced the unveiling of his AI chatbot, Grok 3, during a live demonstration on Feb. 17 at 8 p.m. PST (04.00 GMT on Feb. 18).
- The chatbot is being developed by Musk's company, xAI.
- Musk indicated Grok 3 was nearing completion and expected to be released within one to two weeks.

items.title: Aramco‚Äôs VC arm invests in AI cloud startup Ori
items.summary:
- Saudi Aramco‚Äôs venture capital arm, Wa‚Äôed Ventures, has invested in UK-based AI cloud startup Ori.
- This is part of Saudi Arabia‚Äôs strategy to become a regional hub for AI.
- Wa‚Äôed Ventures manages a $500 million fund focused on AI investments.
- Ori plans to open a subsidiary in Riyadh to enhance AI technologies and develop local talent.
- Founded in 2019, Ori specializes in cloud infrastructure for AI applications and works with large corporations.
- Ori was among the first in the UK to utilize Nvidia‚Äôs H200 chips.

items.title: Tencent‚Äôs Weixin app launches DeepSeek search testing
items.summary:
- Tencent‚Äôs Weixin app begins beta testing the DeepSeek AI model to enhance search functionalities.
- This move shows Tencent's collaboration with an external AI platform, amidst growing competition in AI tech.
- Weixin will continue using its proprietary Hunyuan-Large language model for AI search enhancements.
- DeepSeek integration is exclusive to Weixin and will not be available on the international version, WeChat.

items.title: India startup IPOs: on a knife-edge
items.summary:
- India‚Äôs IPO market saw 13 startup IPOs raising over 290 billion rupees (US$3.4 billion) in 2024.
- Major companies like Swiggy and Ola Electric were among the IPOs, with expectations for 2025 to exceed US$23 billion in fundraising.
- Recent declines in India‚Äôs NIFTY 500 index by 15% raise concerns about upcoming IPO performance and potential cash burn risks.
- Analysts express mixed opinions, with some expecting favorable conditions and others warning of increased downside risks after 2024's IPO performance.

items.title: Tracking startup closures across Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- Approximately 90% of startups worldwide fail, with two-thirds not providing a positive return to investors.
- Southeast Asia lacks comprehensive data on startup failure, leading to a need for macro-level trends analysis in the region.
- Key causes of failure include inability to raise capital, lack of market need, competition, and possibly varying ecosystem maturity among countries.
- Early-stage companies are more unstable, and their size may influence their failure rates.

items.title: SEA food delivery grows 13% as Grab leads: report
items.summary:
‚Ä¢ Southeast Asia‚Äôs food delivery platforms achieved a gross merchandise value (GMV) of US$19.3 billion in 2024, reflecting a 13% year-on-year growth.
‚Ä¢ Vietnam and Indonesia reported GMV growth rates of 26% and 18%, respectively.
‚Ä¢ Grab remains the market leader, while ShopeeFood surpassed Gojek as the third-largest platform, driven by lower delivery fees.
‚Ä¢ Industry disruptions are expected with TikTok piloting food voucher sales in Indonesia and Thailand.
‚Ä¢ Potential Grab-Gojek merger discussions could reshape the market in 2025.
‚Ä¢ Leading players hold over 80% of the market share in most Southeast Asian countries.

items.title: Indonesian online motorcycle taxi drivers to rally for labor rights
items.summary:
- Indonesian Transportation Workers‚Äô Union (SPAI) announced a protest for online motorcycle taxi drivers on **Feb. 17**.
- Demonstration starts at **10 am** in front of the **Ministry of Manpower** in Jakarta, expected to draw **500 to 1,000** participants.
- Drivers from Jakarta and regions like Sukabumi, Dumai, Pontianak, and Pangkal Pinang will temporarily cease operations by going **off bid**.
- Protest aims to advocate for **labor rights**, focusing on demands for **holiday allowances**, amidst claims of economic injustice by platform companies.
- SPAI criticized the partnership system allowing companies to bypass obligations like minimum wages and overtime pay, with drivers working extensive hours to meet financial needs.
- The protest coincides with a **coordinated shutdown** of ride-hailing apps in multiple cities.

items.title: China‚Äôs sex doll maker sees sales up by 30% in 2025 ‚Äì thanks to AI
Paw-sitive about pet tech
items.author: Melissa Goh
items.summary:
- Pet ownership is on the rise as more people choose pets over children.
- The pet tech sector in Asia Pacific is expected to grow faster than in North America and Europe in the next five years.
- In Singapore, pet owners are projected to spend an average of US$195 per year on their pets in 2024, more than double what is spent by counterparts in Thailand and Malaysia.
- Pet products and services are increasingly paralleling those in the baby market, including premium food, daycare, and telehealth services.

items.title: Series SEA: Who‚Äôs investing in the region‚Äôs AI startups?
items.summary:
- The article presents a list of active investors in Southeast Asia‚Äôs AI sector over the past two years.
- It emphasizes the number of deals done, favoring early-stage investors.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region within the specified timeframe are featured.

items.title: US State Dept pauses $400m armored EV plan involving Tesla
items.summary:
- The US State Department has paused a US$400 million purchase of armored EVs involving Tesla.
- Tesla was the only manufacturer to show interest since May 2024, but no contracts were awarded.
- The request for bids, initially set for May 2025, is now indefinitely on hold without plans to resume.
- The agency revised its forecast, clarifying Tesla was mistakenly listed, with potential vendors including BMW instead.

items.title: OpenAI merges o3 into GPT-5, plans GPT-4.5 release first
items.author: Sam Altman
items.summary:
- OpenAI cancels the release of the o3 AI model, integrating its features into GPT-5.
- GPT-5 will be available for ChatGPT and its API, but no release date has been provided.
- Prior to GPT-5, OpenAI will release GPT-4.5 as the final version of its ‚Äúnon-chain-of-thought model.‚Äù

items.title: India to make its first chip by October 2025 under plan
items.summary:
- India plans to produce its first domestically manufactured semiconductor chip by September or October 2025, as announced by IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
- Tata Electronics is constructing a semiconductor unit in Dholera, Gujarat, in collaboration with Taiwan‚Äôs Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing Corporation.
- Micron's assembly and testing facility in Sanand, Gujarat, is reported to be 60% complete.
- The Indian government has allocated 334 crore rupees (approximately US$38.52 million) to IISc Bengaluru for research in gallium nitride technology, important for telecommunications and power sectors.
- The first phase of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM 1.0) includes upgrading a semiconductor lab in Mohali, with preparations for ISM 2.0 pending Cabinet approval.
- This initiative is part of India's effort to become a global semiconductor hub under the Semicon India program, which was launched in 2021 with an outlay of 76,000 crore rupees (US$8.76 billion).

items.title: Perplexity unveils ‚ÄòDeep Research‚Äô for fast, in-depth AI
items.summary:
- Perplexity has launched its "Deep Research" feature for in-depth research tasks, providing detailed answers with citations in finance, marketing, and product development.
- The feature became available on the web on Feb. 15 and will expand to Mac, iOS, and Android soon.
- Users can perform multi-step analyses, generating reports that can be exported as PDFs or shared as Perplexity Pages.
- It achieved a score of 21.1% on Humanity‚Äôs Last Exam, outperforming Gemini Thinking (6.2%) and GPT-4o (3.3%), but below OpenAI‚Äôs Deep Research (26.6%).
- Unlike OpenAI‚Äôs $200 monthly subscription model, Perplexity offers a freemium model with limited free queries and unlimited access for subscribers.
- Perplexity completes tasks in under three minutes, faster than OpenAI‚Äôs 5 to 30 minutes.
- The focus is on accessibility and speed, contrasting with OpenAI‚Äôs enterprise user model and Google‚Äôs integration with productivity tools.

items.title: Indian loyalty startup raises $1.85m seed funding
items.author: Abhinav Jain, Apurv Modi
items.summary:
- Almonds.ai, an India-based loyalty and rewards platform, raised ‚Çπ16 crore (US$1.85 million) in seed funding.
- Funding led by promoters of Haldiram‚Äôs and JITO Incubation and Innovation Foundation, with participation from several investors.
- Founded in 2020, Almonds.ai plans to use funds to improve AI technology and expand internationally, with operations launched in Dubai and partnerships in Singapore.
- In FY24, reported revenue of ‚Çπ35 crore (US$4.04 million) with a 12% EBITDA margin, targeting over ‚Çπ200 crore (US$23.06 million) in revenue for FY25 at a 15% EBITDA margin.

items.title: Chinese spatial tech firm seeks HK IPO after Nasdaq setback
items.summary:
- Manycore Tech, a Chinese start-up specializing in spatial design, has filed for an IPO in Hong Kong.
- The company previously attempted to list on Nasdaq three years ago but was unsuccessful.
- Founded in 2011, Manycore claims to operate the world‚Äôs largest spatial design platform.
- The IPO is backed by JPMorgan and CCB International; the funding target remains undisclosed but was previously reported as US$200 million.
- In 2023, Manycore was noted for having the highest number of monthly active users among spatial design platforms globally and leading China‚Äôs sector in revenue.
- The company has attracted investments from IDG Capital, Hillhouse Investment, and Coatue Management, achieving a valuation of US$2 billion after a 2020 funding round.

items.title: Uber sues DoorDash over alleged anti-competitive tactics
items.summary:
- Uber has filed a lawsuit against DoorDash in the Superior Court of California, claiming anti-competitive practices.
- The lawsuit alleges DoorDash pressures restaurants into exclusive delivery agreements, limiting competition.
- DoorDash denies these allegations, stating it manages delivery for over 90% of large restaurant chains in the US.
- Uber cites reports of restaurants feeling pressured with threats of higher fees if they use Uber‚Äôs service.
- The company is seeking a jury trial, with specific damages not disclosed.

items.title: Xi Jinping to meet tech leaders as DeepSeek advances tech
items.summary:
- Chinese President Xi Jinping will meet with 20 to 30 top private-sector entrepreneurs in Beijing on Feb. 17.
- Attendees include leaders from major technology firms, including the 'Six Little Dragons' from Hangzhou.
- The discussion focuses on advancements in technology and comes before China‚Äôs annual legislative and political advisory sessions addressing economic recovery and US trade challenges.
- The meeting follows developments from firms like Huawei and DeepSeek launching technologies to counter US trade restrictions.

items.title: Bangladesh in talks with Elon Musk on Starlink launch
items.summary:
- Bangladesh is in discussions with Elon Musk regarding the launch of Starlink, his satellite internet service.
- The initiative aims to improve internet access across Bangladesh, especially in rural areas.
- Starlink could potentially enhance connectivity and provide high-speed internet to underserved populations.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia‚Äôs funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores funding trends and notable investors in Southeast Asia.
- It includes two sections: 'weekly update' for recent data points and 'macro trends' for an overview of funding distribution across regions and sectors.
- Visuals and infographics are utilized to present data, but premium content restrictions apply.

items.title: OpenAI board rejects Elon Musk‚Äôs $94.7b takeover bid
items.summary:
- OpenAI‚Äôs board rejected Elon Musk‚Äôs $97.4 billion acquisition bid, stating that "OpenAI is not for sale."  
- Musk aimed to return OpenAI to its open-source roots with backing from investors.  
- CEO Sam Altman criticized the bid as a hindrance to progress, and legal counsel asserted that competitors cannot dictate OpenAI‚Äôs mission.  
- Musk's bid followed lawsuits against OpenAI related to its for-profit model, with indications of withdrawing if OpenAI abandons its profit-driven approach.  
- The board's decision occurs as OpenAI seeks fundraising with SoftBank, potentially valuing the company at $300 billion.

items.title: Bitcoin transactions drop 55% as traders move elsewhere
items.summary:
- Bitcoin's 7-day moving average transactions fell to 330,000, a 55% drop from 730,000.
- Transaction fees have remained steady at approximately US$500,000 for the last month.
- Runes and Ordinals now represent only 1% of total bitcoin transactions.
- Fee revenue from Runes dropped to under US$20,000 from US$60 million at its launch.
- Traders are shifting interest to Solana for memecoin trading and Base for AI agent tokens.
- Concerns arise about bitcoin's fee-based model and long-term sustainability as block rewards decrease.
- Engagement with new protocols will be crucial for bitcoin's future.

items.title: Apple‚Äôs Siri revamp faces delays due to software issues
items.summary:
- Apple‚Äôs Siri revamp may be delayed due to software bugs and engineering challenges.
- Originally scheduled for an April launch with iOS 18.4, updates could be postponed until May or later.
- Some employees reported inconsistencies, prompting Apple to consider a release in an inactive state first for iOS 18.5.
- Key upgrades aim to enhance file retrieval, but features like scanning emails for travel plans may be delayed.
- Setbacks could affect Apple‚Äôs upcoming smart home hub that depends on Siri‚Äôs functions.
- Despite challenges, Apple is committed to AI advancements; strong iPhone sales noted in regions with Apple Intelligence.
- Further improvements to Siri expected to continue until 2026.

items.title: Meta launches AI-powered humanoid robotics division
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms is launching a new AI-powered humanoid robotics division in its Reality Labs.
- The division aims to compete with companies like Nvidia-backed Figure AI and Tesla.
- CTO Andrew Bosworth shared that the team will develop consumer humanoid robots using Meta‚Äôs Llama AI models.
- Marc Whitten, former CEO of Cruise, is leading the effort, with John Koryl appointed as VP of Retail.
- Despite losing about $5 billion in Q4 2024, Meta is committed to AI-driven robotics.
- The company is investing in ‚Äúembodied AI‚Äù and collaborating with Unitree Robotics and Figure AI.
- Meta is currently testing retail strategies and has delayed its branded robot hardware.

items.title: Musk‚Äôs xAI seeks $10b funding, eyes $75b valuation
items.summary:
- Elon Musk‚Äôs AI company, xAI, is looking to raise approximately US$10 billion in funding, potentially valuing the company at US$75 billion.
- Existing investors like Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Valor Equity Partners are in discussions for participation.
- xAI was previously valued at US$51 billion after raising US$6 billion across two rounds in 2024.
- The company aims to compete with OpenAI, featuring its chatbot Grok integrated into Musk‚Äôs platform X.
- A public release of the Grok 3 chatbot is anticipated soon.
- xAI is negotiating a server purchase deal with Dell Technologies exceeding US$5 billion.

items.title: TSMC weighs control of Intel‚Äôs US plants after Trump talks
items.summary:
- TSMC is considering a controlling stake in Intel‚Äôs US factories after discussions with the Trump administration.
- The potential deal aims to enhance US chip manufacturing and secure leadership in critical technologies.
- Key negotiation involves TSMC possibly managing Intel‚Äôs production facilities to help address Intel‚Äôs financial difficulties and support localization efforts.
- Intel has not disclosed its position, but concerns about foreign control have been raised by a White House official.
- Intel is facing financial challenges and has been cutting jobs and scaling back expansion plans.
- Federal officials are exploring partnerships with other chipmakers as strategic options.
- TSMC previously showed no interest in Intel‚Äôs factories but may be reconsidering due to increasing US-China tech tensions.
- Both TSMC and Intel have declined to comment on the potential deal.

items.title: Microsoft-backed robotics startup eyes $39.5b valuation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Figure AI, focused on humanoid robots, aims to secure US$1.5 billion in funding for a valuation of US$39.5 billion.
- This valuation is a significant increase from US$2.6 billion last year.
- Current investors include Microsoft, OpenAI, Nvidia, and Jeff Bezos.
- The company is leveraging advancements in reasoning technology for faster adoption of robots, targeting home use within a few years.
- Figure AI aims to help address labor shortages by performing dangerous tasks, with BMW AG as a customer.
- The interest in robotics is growing, with projects from Tesla and Meta involving collaborations with companies like Figure and Unitree Robotics.

items.title: Something for every curious mind üß†
items.summary:
- The article discusses various funding deals across industries, including fintech and brain-computer interfaces.
- Significant investments include Tabby raising US$160 million in Series E funding and Harrison.ai raising US$112 million in Series C.
- Includes a list of mergers and acquisitions such as Kartini's acquisition by Libera Global AI and Joper.app's acquisition by KiranaPro.
- The article highlights the challenges of fundraising and promotes a platform called Glasswall for feedback on investors.
- Features insights into tech networking events across Southeast Asia, emphasizing opportunities for founders and investors.

items.title: Japan‚Äôs top-funded tech companies in the last decade
Anthropic opposes US ban on Google‚Äôs AI investments
items.summary:
- Anthropic has requested a federal court to dismiss a US government proposal restricting Google‚Äôs investments in AI companies.
- The proposal aims to combat Google‚Äôs monopolization of the online search market, as found by a federal judge last year.
- Suggested measures include a forced sale of Google‚Äôs Chrome browser and investment bans in firms managing consumer search data.
- Anthropic, funded with around US$3 billion from Google, argues the restrictions could harm competition and benefit rivals like OpenAI, Meta, and DeepMind.
- The San Francisco-based AI startup states that the proposal would impede its progress in the industry.

items.title: UK government partners with Anthropic to implement AI in public services
items.summary:
- The UK government has signed an agreement with AI startup Anthropic to explore using its chatbot, Claude, in public services.
- The initiative aims to improve citizen interactions with public information and services.
- Anthropic, backed by Google and Amazon, announced the collaboration through a memorandum of understanding.
- This partnership aligns with Prime Minister Keir Starmer‚Äôs strategy to advance AI development in the UK.
- Claude is already used in institutions like the European Parliament for improving document searches.
- The collaboration supports the UK government‚Äôs goal of integrating innovative technologies into public services with proper regulations.

items.title: UK Tech Startup Plain Secures $15M Series A
items.author: Simon Rohrbach, Matt Vagni
items.summary:
- UK-based startup Plain raised $15 million in a series A round led by Battery Ventures, with participation from Index Ventures and Connect Ventures.
- The funding will facilitate expansion, including opening its first US office in San Francisco.
- Plain, founded by former Deliveroo employees, offers an API-based platform that consolidates customer support channels such as Slack, Microsoft Teams, Discord, email, and chat.
- Notable customers include Sanity, Laravel, Stytch, and Raycast.
- The customer support sector is experiencing growth, with new players like Pylon and Thena emerging.

items.title: Saudi digital bank Derayah sets IPO price at $8 per share
items.summary:
- Derayah Financial Company set its IPO offer price at 30 riyal (US$8) per share.
- The IPO attracted total orders of 243 billion riyal (US$64.79 billion), oversubscribing by about 162 times.
- The company is valued at 7.5 billion riyal (US$2 billion) upon listing, with a total offering size of 1.5 billion riyal (US$400 million).
- 49,947,039 ordinary shares are included, representing 20% of the company‚Äôs capital.
- Subscription period for individual investors is from Feb. 20 to Feb. 22.
- Listing date on Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Main Market will be confirmed after regulatory approvals.
- HSBC Saudi Arabia is the financial advisor and underwriter for the offering.

items.title: Forrest Li considers running for SG football assoc. presidency
items.summary:
- Billionaire and Sea Limited founder Forrest Li is reportedly considering running for the presidency of the Football Association of Singapore (FAS).
- A spokesperson for Li confirmed he is evaluating his candidacy following suggestions from the football community.
- Li is a naturalized Singapore citizen born in Tianjin, China, and has served as a FAS council member from 2017 to 2021.

items.title: Chinese EV firm Zeekr to unveil self-driving system
items.summary:
- Zeekr Intelligent Technology, a subsidiary of Geely Auto, will unveil its Level 3 autonomous driving system at the Shanghai Auto Show in April 2025.
- Zeekr recently merged with Lynk, acquiring a 51% stake, which strengthens Geely's premium EV ecosystem.
- The in-house L3 system claims improvements in computing power, performance, safety, and structural design.
- Zeekr is among several Chinese automakers, like BYD, that are expanding into autonomous driving technology.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- Fundraising is challenging, and this article lists fundraising startups for easier access.
- Startups can sign up for a listing to reach investors via email.
- Investors can opt-in to receive curated lists of fundraising startups if they are paying subscribers.

items.title: Airbnb to launch AI customer support system
items.summary:
- Airbnb plans to implement AI in customer support operations starting Q4 2024, with a rollout expected in summer 2024.
- The AI system aims to function as a customer service agent with capabilities to handle multiple languages and large data.
- CEO Brian Chesky stated AI is still in development and is not ready for trip planning or advanced integrations yet.
- Future AI developments may enhance search functions and concierge-like features.
- CFO Ellie Mertz mentioned potential cost efficiencies in customer service and payment processing due to AI.

items.title: Mobility platform Rapido to launch women-only bike taxis
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based Rapido plans to launch a women-only bike taxi service called ‚ÄúPink Bikes‚Äù in Karnataka by the end of 2025.
- The service will feature female drivers exclusively for female passengers.
- Co-founder Pavan Guntupalli aims to create 25,000 job opportunities for women and ensure safer commutes.
- This initiative follows Uber India's launch of ‚ÄúUber Moto Women‚Äù in December 2024 with 250 female riders.
- The move reflects a trend among ride-hailing companies focusing on safety and inclusivity for women.

items.title: Airbnb shares surge 15% after strong Q4 earnings
items.summary:
- Airbnb‚Äôs shares increased by 15% in after-hours trading on February 13, following stronger-than-expected Q4 earnings.
- The company reported earnings of 73 cents per share, exceeding the anticipated 58 cents, with revenues of $2.48 billion, up 12% YoY.
- Net income improved to $461 million from a loss of $349 million last year.
- Q1 2025 revenue projections were slightly below analysts‚Äô expectations at $2.23 billion to $2.27 billion.
- Key metrics included a 4% rise in adjusted profit to $765 million and 111 million booked nights and experiences, a 12% increase.
- The average daily rate rose by 1% to $158, with over five million hosts and eight million active listings currently.
- Airbnb.org has aided over 19,000 individuals and 2,300 pets affected by wildfires in Los Angeles.
- The company attributes improved conversion rates to tech upgrades and plans to launch new offerings in May.

items.title: Indian electric bus manufacturer raises $29m funding
items.summary:
- PMI Electro Mobility has raised ‚Çπ250 crore (US$29 million) through a funding round via preferential allotment of equity shares.
- Investors include Authum Investment & Infrastructure, Gruhas, Antique Securities, and several high-net-worth family offices.
- Funds will be used to improve production capabilities, scale operations, and develop new solutions.
- Founded in 2017, PMI operates a fleet of 2,000 electric buses across 31 cities with an annual manufacturing capacity of over 2,500 buses.
- PMI holds an order book for more than 3,000 vehicles and previously secured ‚Çπ250 crore from Piramal Alternative Funds in 2023.
- The funding coincides with India's push for electric vehicle adoption, backed by the PM E-DRIVE scheme for over 14,000 electric buses.
- India's EV market is valued at US$54 billion and is projected to reach US$132 billion by 2030, indicating significant growth opportunities.

items.title: Rebel Foods launches 15-minute delivery app
items.summary:
- Rebel Foods has launched a 15-minute food delivery service via its app ‚ÄòQuickiES‚Äô in select locations in Mumbai.
- The app features food from over 45 brands, including Faasos, Wendy‚Äôs, and Oven Story Pizza.
- This service competes with Zomato‚Äôs Blinkit and Swiggy Instamart in the fast food delivery market.
- The competitive landscape is intensifying with interest from larger e-commerce companies like Flipkart and Amazon.
- Rebel Foods, founded in 2011, has raised $773 million from investors and may consider a public listing within the next 12 to 18 months.
